builder

Class IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • base.NeighborGraphBase<S,java.util.List<S>>
      • base.IndexedNeighborGraphBase<S>
        • builder.IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexedNeighborGraph<S>, ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>, NeighborGraph<S>

    public class IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder<S>
extends IndexedNeighborGraphBase<S>
implements ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
    An extension of IndexedNeighborGraphBase that implements the ModifiableNeighborGraph interface. The indexing of the vertex set is defined by the insertion order of the graph construction.
    Author:
    pdokos

    • Nested Class Summary

      Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder.
      IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder(int degree)
      Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder which is of a uniform vertex degree (i.e. a regular graph).
      IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder(int numVerts, int degree)
      Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder which has a known number of vertices and is of uniform vertex degree (i.e. a regular graph).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addVertex(S s)
      Adds the object s to the vertex set of the graph, with the neighbor set of s initialized as empty; the index of the s is set to 1 more than that of the previously added vertex, with the index of the first added vertex set to 1.
      void finish()
      Sets the state of building to finished, and sorts the neighbor lists according to the indexing on the vertices.
      boolean join(S src, S tgt)
      Joins the vertices src and tgt within the graph.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder

        public IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder()
        Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder.

      • IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder

        public IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder(int degree)
        Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder which is of a uniform vertex degree (i.e. a regular graph).
        Parameters:
        degree - the designated valency of each vertex.

      • IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder

        public IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder(int numVerts,
                           int degree)
        Constructor for an IndexedNeighborGraphBuilder which has a known number of vertices and is of uniform vertex degree (i.e. a regular graph). By specifying numVerts and degree, this constructor preallocates the requisite memory for holding the graph.
        Parameters:
        numVerts - the designated number of vertices of the graph.
        degree - the designated valency of each vertex.

    • Method Detail

      • addVertex

        public boolean addVertex(S s)
        Adds the object s to the vertex set of the graph, with the neighbor set of s initialized as empty; the index of the s is set to 1 more than that of the previously added vertex, with the index of the first added vertex set to 1. Subsequent calls to the containsVertex method of the NeighborGraph interface return true when evaluated on an object equivalent to s under the equals method of S.
        Specified by:
        addVertex in interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
        Parameters:
        s - any object of type S.
        Returns:
        true if the graph does not already contain s, and s was successfully added to the vertex set of the graph.

      • join

        public boolean join(S src,
           S tgt)
        Joins the vertices src and tgt within the graph. These vertices are added to the vertex set of the graph if they are not already members. If the vertices were successfully joined, then subsequent calls to the method hasEdgeJoining(src, tgt) and hasEdgeJoining(tgt, src) return true.
        Specified by:
        join in interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
        Parameters:
        src - any object of type S.
        tgt - any object of type S.
        Returns:
        true if src and tgt were successfully joined.

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Sets the state of building to finished, and sorts the neighbor lists according to the indexing on the vertices. This cannot be undone, subsequent calls to addVertex and join return false and do not modify the graph. If the graph was specified as regular, or as having a certain number of vertices upon construction, then this method should only be called when these conditions are true.
        Specified by:
        finish in interface ModifiableNeighborGraph<S>
